snippet: They might be called the “rats of the sky,” but Charles Darwin certainly saw something in pigeons. It turns out the father of evolution saw in the birds an amazing variety of variation in color, shape and form.
lead_paragraph: They might be called the “rats of the sky,” but Charles Darwin certainly saw something in pigeons. It turns out the father of evolution saw in the birds an amazing variety of variation in color, shape and form.

headline.seo: Darwin’s Pigeons, in All Their Genetic Variety
headline.main: Pigeons, in All Their Genetic Variety
